data.title: Add feature to open multiple files at a time using open file open(Cmd + P or Ctrl + P)

data.title: document.isDirty in onDidChangeTextDocument is not correct on first change
Theming: .panel.integrated-terminal color is hardcoded even though color exists
data.body:
There is `terminal.foreground` and it seems to work but there is also a fixed color for the terminal in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/terminal/electron-browser/media/terminal.css#L16. When I remove that one and do not specify a `terminal.foreground`, I see no color applied.

Can we remove the CSS and make sure there is a good default for `terminal.foreground`?

Unsure how this issue can be reproduced.
I sporadically, more often the last few days, into the issue that I can't save a file I'm working on.

Happened about a dozen times to me now across different repos and file types.
I then close VSCode, reopen it, I still see the old version, get frustrated, change the file again, now I can save and VSCode tells me that the file on disk is newer than what I'm trying to save.

In the meantime I turned on "autosave" and that works, but isn't really what I want.

data.title: Revisit search include/exclude and './' patterns
data.body:
Need to spend time thinking about the include/exclude pattern experience, the interactions between the include/exclude fields, .gitignore, and search/files.exclude, and whether `./` is needed or if there's a better way to achieve the effect, and how this all works in a multi-root world.

Related issues:
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29924
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29660
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23894
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/26574
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/26634
- #17164

data.title: [Bug] Weird Behavior in integrated bash terminal in Win 10
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Win 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In win 10 open integrated terminal with window maximized.
1. Clear and see bash terminal cursor at start of line, and line characters overlapping.
1. Type few chars and delete 1, the line with info about the terminal is gone.
1. Exit maximized mode to window, resize and verify it now works as intended.

**Gif proof:**
![weirdintegratedterminalbehavior](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9698639/26433562/2048392a-40c9-11e7-9742-35eb2353e3f4.gif)

**Extra data:**
Please note i'm in Win 10, using the new Bash terminal with login shell active (take a look at gif's config highlighted in right panel).

data.title: Split view workflow
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any file
2. Click split view
3. Observe a duplicate pane of exact file is created.

Expectation: I know Visual Studio works the same, however I'd expect something like Sublime where you either get a blank pane or the active file to be moved into the new split pane.

data.title: Source Control files are not respecting preview mode setting behavior
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Be sure `workbench.editor.enablePreview` is not overriden in user or workspace settings
2. Switch to Source Control view
3. Single-click a changed file
4. File is open in permanent mode (regular title) instead of preview mode (italic title)

data.title: Cygwin's clear command doesn't work properly on Integrated Terminal

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

This is what happens:
![clear](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22898638/26428012/ab02a802-409c-11e7-82f0-4af4bdb29f1b.gif)

CMD and PowerShell do work though.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install Cygwin with `chere` package
2. settings.json: `"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\cygwin64\\bin\\bash.exe"`
3. settings.json: `"terminal.integrated.shellArgs.windows": ["/bin/xhere", "/bin/bash"]`
4. Open Integrated Terminal
5. Do something like `echo "something"`
6. `clear`

data.title: [WIP] Inline all decorations - attempt 2

This is follow up on https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/20042.
Original issue:  https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19749

CC:  @jrieken

This is not ready yet, but I just would love to get some input whether I'm moving in right direction. 
Right now I'm just trying to replicate current behavior [without adding possibility to display all errors] but moving implementation to `IViewZone` as described in comments in original PR.

data.title: [WIP] Add leading commas json formatting option
data.body:
ðŸ‘‹ 

I thought I'd try to see if I can add this feature. I have something that's working in the one test that I added and I got some questions so I figured I'd open up a PR early, maybe get some pointers on some stuff that I'm not sure how to add? Hope that's ok. I didn't think StackOverflow or Gitter was the best place to ask questions about the codebase.

### Feature description
By changing the key `editor.leadingCommas` to `true`, the JSON formatter will format documents with a leading comma like so:

```json
{ "a": null
, "b": null
, "c": null
,}
```

### Things I haven't figured out and am not sure where to ask ðŸ˜¬
- Show `editor.leadingCommas` in user/workspace settings. Not sure why this isn't showing up. I thought adding the key in [`commonEditorConfig.ts`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/compare/master...koddsson:add-leading-commas-json-formatting-option?expand=1#diff-6728189afcd9d7e37ec62aa3e7e67056R232-R236) would do the trick but so far I can't see it when running `./scripts/code.sh`.
- Manually test to see this working. When running `./scripts/code.sh` I get a editor and I can see the code in the Developer Tools but I can't get my breakpoints to hit so I can debug why the formatter actually isn't working in the editor
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/318208/26426777/04fd9b70-40d2-11e7-88c8-862505b3976f.png)
- Moving the settings key from `editor.leadingCommas` to something like `json.format.leadingCommas`? I figured I'd get this working first and then I can move it.
- Add more test cases. My one test case is maybe not enough to cover all the cases we wanna cover.

I hope this is cool and it's not just more noise for you maintainers ðŸ˜º

data.title: Unable to position the cursor in the editor using braille routing keys in NVDA
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:20:36.315Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a file in the editor
2. Ensure NVDA is in focus mode (for example by pressing space/enter on the editor)
3. Use a cursor routing button on a connected braille display and click on a character in the text

Expected:

The cursor moves to the chosen position.

Actual:

Cursor doesn't move in the editor, but the cursor is displayed on the right position in braille in the textarea used for editor accessibility until it refreshes (e.g. by moving cursor using the keyboard).

data.title: Fix 27195 - Json colorization of /**/
data.body:
Make sure we handle the case of `/**/` properly in json files. Fix is to make sure we don't match `/**` the start of documentation if followed by a `/`

Fixes #27195

data.title: Opening new window from command line always waits

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 7
- Using Hyper.js terminal pointing to Git for Windows GitBash

Running `code -n .` in my terminal should spawn a new window and clear the prompt, allowing a new command to be entered.  The behavior I am observing, is that it looks like the `--wait` option is always being passed.  

Steps to Reproduce:
1. `code -n .`
2. Terminal waits for opened window to close.
3. `CTRL-C` closes the newly opened window

data.title: Intellisense stuck at Loading after attempting to get suggestions within a pair of strings.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (7403245d3d42edab8d0c728cf56b8a2db097db7f, 2017-05-23T05:14:19.493Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: the listing exceeds the lower minimum of browsers' URL characters limit
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Insert cursor within strings single quoted or double quoted.
2. Attempt to search for suggestions `ctrl + spacebar`

After trying to search for suggestions intellisense continues to display `Loading ...` if I am writing within a pair of strings. I then have to reload the application in order for it to work properly.

data.title: Using dollar sign ($) at the variable name breaks Codelens reference count
data.body:
If I want to use `$` to indicate that the variable is an Observable, Codelens' reference count for that variable stops working.

data.title: SPRemoteAPI Extension Intellisense:  Matching libraries/interfaces do not display below the command palette on Mac OS X Sierra
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:13:11.413Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: the listing exceeds the lower minimum of browsers' URL characters limit
---

SPRemoteAPI Extension Intellisense:  Matching libraries/interfaces do not display below the command palette on Mac OS X Sierra as matching names are entered.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install VSCODE with all updates
2. Add SPRemoteAPI Extension
3. Open Command Palett
4. Enter keywords "Microsoft" or "move" as shown in the documentation
5. SPRemoteAPI should list libraries/interfaces that start with the keyword entered - a busy indication (moving cursor)  is displayed below cycling from left to right.   
6. Works correctly on Windows 10

data.title: "Unable to load schema from ..." "Error: self signed certificate in certificate chain" - Corporate Proxy

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Enterprise SP1

Steps to Reproduce:

NOTE: This is certainly caused by my corporate proxy. It is normally configured via PAC. I have set the following into my settings.json:

`
"http.proxy": "http://<host>:<port>"
"http.proxyStrictSSL": false
`

1. Load file into editor (https://gist.github.com/jheiselman/92d826586e8a1a7db67fe11b8fa2aaab#file-netcool-tmlanguage-json)
1. Observe "Problems" tab and see error as below:

`
Unable to load schema from 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/martinring/tmlanguage/master/tmlanguage.json': Unable to connect to https://raw.githubusercontent.com/martinring/tmlanguage/master/tmLanguage.json through a proxy. Error: self signed certificate in certificate chain
`

data.title: Duplicates in Go to File list
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.3|
|tslint|eg2|0.15.0|
|vscode-stylefmt|mrmlnc|2.4.1|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.9.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|1.0.0|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.1|
|material-icon-theme|PKief|2.0.6|
|stylelint|shinnn|0.24.0|

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Open "Go to File..." menu.
1. Type pattern to find a file.
1. For some files the search list contains the file twice.
1. The duplicate will be opened in a separate tab. The tab tooltip shows that the path is different from original one in the case, e.g. the original path is "C:\Projects\Project\file.ts" but the duplicate has "C:\projects\project\file.ts".

Expected
The files should be presented once in the list and the paths should correspond to OS ones.

Is there a way to fix it? As that behavior often leads me to a difference in the content of same file if I use "Go to File..." to switch between tabs. And I cannot determine the path difference in recently opened list.

Notes
* If I try to find files by pattern containing folder name, e.g. "proj file", then the recently opened list is empty and the file results one contains the single match (no duplicate).
* I tried to clear the recent files, no success.
* I tried to disable all extensions, no success.

data.title: Request: Add two software languages, and IntelliSense for both

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Considering the effort that Microsoft's development team has put forward to produce the Power BI desktop and service suite, it makes sense to me that Visual Studio Code should recognize DAX (*.dax) files and M-language (*.m) files.

When can we expect DAX and M to be supported?
